name: ONE-PAN BEEF, CORN AND PTITIM!
ingredients: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and saut√© until it starts to soften. Season with salt, black pepper, turmeric, and garlic powder, and stir for about 30 seconds.
2. Add the ground beef. Using a wooden spoon break it up and stir occasionally, until browned. About 7-8 minutes.
3. Stir in the frozen corn, p‚Äôtitim, chopped dill and cilantro, and date syrup. Mix well, then pour in the boiling water and stir again.

4. Cover with a lid, reduce heat to low, and cook until the liquid is absorbed and the p‚Äôtitim is tender. If it looks dry before the p‚Äôtitim is soft, add a small splash of water and keep cooking covered.
5. Fluff gently, garnish with chopped dill, and serve.

name: ARUK ARAYES!
ingredients: 6 golden potatoes, peeled and cooked until very soft
6 scallions (green onions), finely chopped, including the green part
1. In a bowl mash the cooked potatoes to a slightly chunky consistency and let them cool slightly.
2. Add the scallions, parsley, ground beef, salt, pepper, turmeric, garlic powder, baharat and egg. Mix very well until evenly combined.
3. Open up each pita half and stuff it with the Beef Aruk mixture.
4. On the stove on medium heat, pour 5 tablespoons of olive oil into a grilling pan.
5. Sear each stuffed pita face down for 4 minutes until it gets a nice brown color.
6. Then sear both sides of the pita for 2-3 minutes on each side.
7. Spray olive oil or avocado oil on top of the pitas. Transfer to a preheated oven on 400F/200C for 8 more minutes.
8. Serve with a drizzle of tahini, amba, green schug, and sumac onions.

name: Shabbat is calling!
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, rinsed and drained
1. Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the shallot, carrots, and chickpeas.
2. Add salt, pepper, turmeric, and coriander. Stir and cook for about 3 minutes.
3. Add the rice and dill. Mix well until everything is coated and turns a beautiful golden color.
4. Pour in the boiling water, stir, and cook on high heat for 1 minute.
5. Lower the heat, cover, and cook for 20 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the shallot, carrots, and chickpeas.

Pour in the boiling water, stir, and cook on high heat for 1 minute.
Lower the heat, cover, and cook for 20 minutes. Fluff with a fork.

name: ROASTED RED CABBAGE AND QUINOA SALAD!
ingredients: 1 red cabbage, cut in half and thinly sliced
1 red onion, cut in half and thinly sliced
1. Preheat the oven to convection broil at 450F.
2. Place the sliced cabbage and onion on a baking pan. Season with flaky salt and olive oil.
3. Mix well and massage with your hands until slightly softened.
4. Spread evenly and roast for about 20 minutes, mixing a few times during roasting so the vegetables brown evenly.
5. In a large bowl, combine the chopped herbs, quinoa, dates, and nuts.
6. Add the roasted cabbage and onions.
7. Season with salt, black pepper, sumac, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, Dijon mustard and date syrup.

Mix everything well and serve.

name: BEEF STEW WITH CHICKPEAS!
ingredients: 3 pounds of beef stew, cut to cubes
1. Powder the beef stew cubes with the flour.
2. On medium heat, in a wide skillet pan, pour the olive oil and add the sliced onions and garlic cloves. Stir for 1 minute.
3. Add the beef stew and sear it for about 2 minutes until it gets a nice golden brown color.
4. Season with: salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and Ras el Hanut. Stir the beef with all the spices.
5. Add the chickpeas, tomato paste, and date syrup and mix it all together.
6. Pour water to cover it all.
7. Cover with a lid and cook for 30 minutes on the stove on medium heat.
8. Transfer to the oven on 350F for 2.5-3 hours. After every hour check to see if the liquid covers the meat. If not add water.

name: ORANGE SUMAC CHICKEN DINNER!
ingredients: 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
2 fennel bulbs including leaves, cut to quarters
10 gold potatoes, peeled and cut to quarters
5 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
2. In a round oven-safe pan (16 inches) drizzle olive oil and flaky salt.
3. Arrange the orange slices on the bottom, then place the chicken thighs on top.
4. Spread the garlic cloves, red onions, fennel (including the leaves) and potatoes around.
5. Season it all with: salt, black pepper, sumac, dried parsley, dried oregano, drizzle of date syrup, and olive oil.
6. Cover with wet parchment paper and aluminum foil.
7. Bake in the oven on 420F / 220C for 45 minutes.
8. Remove the cover and bake for 10 more minutes.
9. Increase the oven to 450F on broil and broil for 7-8 minutes, until golden.

name: Festive Tu BiShvat Salad!
ingredients: 1 package (8oz) of crispy green leaf lettuce
2 packages of Halloumi cheese, 7 Oz (200g) each
1. In a salad bowl put the lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, radishes, red onion, dried apricot, and slivered almonds.
2. Remove the Halloumi cheese from the package. Using a paper towel tap the cheese to dry all the liquid.
3. Slice the Halloumi cheese to thick slices and then to cubes.
4. On a skillet pan on medium heat, pour the avocado oil and add the Halloumi cheese cubes. Fry them from both sides for about 1 minute until they get golden brown.
5. Add the fried Halloumi cubes on top of the vegetables.
6. Pour the tarragon tahini dressing on top and mix gently.

name: THE BEAUTIFUL CAULIFLOWER!
ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, cut into small florets
1/3 cup cold iced water, plus more as needed
1. Heat oven to 450F on convection broil or roast.
2. Place the cauliflower on a baking sheet, season with salt and olive oil, and toss well. Spread in one even layer.
3. Roast for around 12 minutes, until golden and crisp on the edges.
4. Drizzle some tahini on a serving plate. Arrange the roasted cauliflower on top and drizzle with more tahini.
5. Finish with herbs, dates, pomegranate seeds , sumac, a drizzle of olive oil, and more tahini if desired.

name: HALF MOON COOKIES!
ingredients: 1. Preheat oven to 350F / 175C. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a food processor, process the pecans with the light brown sugar until finely ground.
3. In a bowl, mix the ground pecans, almond flour, oat flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and cardamom.
4. Add the egg, vanilla, maple syrup, butter, and milk. Knead it until a soft dough forms.
5. Cover and refrigerate for 30 to 45 minutes.
6. With wet hands, take ping-pong sized balls and shape into half moons. You should get about 28 cookies.
7. Bake for 22 to 25 minutes, until lightly golden.
8. Cool completely, then dust with powdered sugar.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F / 175C. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Add the egg, vanilla, maple syrup, butter, and milk. Knead it until a soft dough forms.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 to 45 minutes.
With wet hands, take ping-pong sized balls and shape into half moons. You should get about 28 cookies.
Bake for 22 to 25 minutes, until lightly golden.
Cool completely, then dust with powdered sugar.

name: CHICKEN MEATBALLS AND RICE NOODLES!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon of date syrup or honey
1 package of thin rice noodles 8.8 oz (250g)
1. In a mixing bowl, combine the ground chicken, shredded zucchini, shredded carrot, shredded onion, and chopped dill.
2. Season with: salt, pepper, turmeric, coriander, garlic powder, semolina flour, egg,  olive oil, and date syrup.
3. Knead the mixture well with your hands until fully combined.
4. Wet your hands and shape the mixture into approximately 30 chicken meatballs.
5. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add olive oil. Place the chicken meatballs in the skillet and sear them on both sides for 5 minutes per side.
6. Let them cook on low heat for 15 minutes (no need to cover with a lid).
7. Add the rice noodles along with the liquid.
8. Gently mix everything together and let it cook over medium heat for an additional 5 minutes.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground chicken, shredded zucchini, shredded carrot, shredded onion, and chopped dill.

Knead the mixture well with your hands until fully combined.
Wet your hands and shape the mixture into approximately 30 chicken meatballs.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and add olive oil. Place the chicken meatballs in the skillet and sear them on both sides for 5 minutes per side.
Let them cook on low heat for 15 minutes (no need to cover with a lid).
Add the rice noodles along with the liquid.
Gently mix everything together and let it cook over medium heat for an additional 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh dill.

name: COZY ONE-PAN KEBAB & POTATO!
ingredients: 2 celery sticks (including the leaves), roughly chopped
10 gold potatoes, peeled and sliced very thin on a mandolin
1. Make the green herbs mixture: In a small food processor, add the onion, zucchini, parsley, and garlic. Process until smooth.
2. In a mixing bowl, add the kebab ingredients and the green herbs mixture. Knead until fully combined. Shape into about 30 oval kebabs.
3. Heat a wide pan over medium heat. Drizzle in the olive oil, then add turmeric, black pepper, and salt. Stir.
4. Add the sliced onion and chopped celery (including the leaves). Mix and cook for about 2 minutes.
5. Add the oval kebabs in two rounds and sear for about 2 minutes.
6. Layer the sliced potatoes on top of the kebabs and season with flaky salt.
7. Cover with a lid and cook for 45 minutes on low heat.

name: ON REPEAT IN MY HOUSE
ingredients: 6 pieces of chicken breast, cut to small cubes
1/3 cup of extra virgin olive oil
2 cups of basmati rice, washed and drained
2. In an oven safe pan place the chicken breasts cubes. Add the rest of the ingredients except for the rice and water.
3. Mix it all together. You can marinate it overnight for additional flavor.
4. Add the rice and mix it. Pour 4 cups of boiling water. Stir it a bit with a spoon.

name: ONE-PAN RECIPE OF THE YEAR
ingredients: 5 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
1 large onion, sliced (you can use a mandolin)
2 cups of basmati rice, washed and drained
1/2 tablespoon of honey or date syrup
1. In a large wide pot on medium heat add the olive oil and the sliced onion. Season with salt, pepper, turmeric and garlic powder. Saut√© and mix the onion with the spices for 1 minute.
2. Add the ground beef and use a wooden spoon to spread out the beef.
3. Mix it all together and cook for 4-5 minutes until the beef is browned.
4. Add the basmati rice, frozen peas, chopped parsley, Dijon mustard and honey. Mix it all well.
5. Pour 4 cups of boiling water and stir a bit. Cover with a lid and a towel.
6. Cook it on medium heat for 5 minutes, then on low heat for 40 minutes.

name: MY MOST VIRAL RECIPE OF 2025
ingredients: 2 sweet onions, cut to halves and sliced
15-20 small gold potatoes, cut to quarters
1. On a skillet pan on medium heat, pour the olive oil. Add the salt, pepper, and turmeric.
2. Add the sliced onions. Fry and mix for 2-3 minutes until they get a clear color.
3. Add the chicken thighs on top. Fry them from both sides at least 5 minutes to get a nice color.
4. Add the garlic cloves and the potatoes around and on top of the chicken thighs.
5. Using a tablespoon, pour the sauce on top of the chicken and the potatoes.
6. Cover with a lid and cook it on low heat for 1 hour.
7. Transfer to convection broil on 450F for 5-7 minutes to get a nice golden color.
8. Garnish with dill leaves and flaky salt.

name: PTITIM AND CHICKEN!
ingredients: 1/4 cup of extra virgin olive oil
1. Heat a 12.5-inch skillet over medium heat and add olive oil. Add the salt, black pepper, turmeric, paprika, and garlic powder, then stir for about 30 seconds to warm up the spices.
2. Add the sliced onion and saut√©, stirring, until softened and lightly golden, about 2-3 minutes.
3. Place the chicken thighs in the pan, skin-side down, and cook until nicely browned, about 10 minutes.
4. Flip and cook the other side until browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes more (about 20 minutes total).
5. Spread the P‚Äôtitim around the chicken. Pour in the boiling water to cover everything. Sprinkle flaky Maldon salt on top.
6. Cover with a lid, reduce the heat to low, and cook until the P‚Äôtitim are tender and the chicken is cooked through, about 25-30 minutes.
7. Garnish with dried parsley and a little more flaky salt if you like.

Place the chicken thighs in the pan, skin-side down, and cook until nicely browned, about 10 minutes.
Flip and cook the other side until browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes more (about 20 minutes total).
Spread the P‚Äôtitim around the chicken. Pour in the boiling water to cover everything. Sprinkle flaky Maldon salt on top.
Cover with a lid, reduce the heat to low, and cook until the P‚Äôtitim are tender and the chicken is cooked through, about 25-30 minutes.
Garnish with dried parsley and a little more flaky salt if you like.

name: FAMILY STYLE HANUKKAH LATKE!
ingredients: 5 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
1. Place a cheesecloth on a cutting board.
2. Shred the potatoes and onion on top of it.
3. Wrap it up and squeeze all the liquid into a bowl. Discard the liquid.
4. Put all the shredded potatoes and onion in a clean bowl. Add the eggs, flour, baking powder, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and chopped dill. Mix it all well.
5. On medium heat, place a nonstick pan on the stove. Drizzle 5 tablespoons of olive oil and sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon of flaky Maldon salt.
6. Pour in the potato mixture and flatten it evenly in the pan.
7. Cook on the stove on medium heat for 5 to 7 minutes to get a nice crust.
8. Transfer to a preheated oven and bake at 420F for 25 minutes. Switch the oven to convection broil at 450F and broil for about 5 minutes to get a nice golden crust.
9. Cut into slices and serve with sour cream and apple sauce.

Add the whole chicken in the middle on top of all.
Brush the paprika paste over the whole chicken. Leave 1/4 portion of the paprika paste for the potatoes.
Mix well the remaining 1/4 portion of the paprika paste with 3/4 cup of water.  Pour it over the potatoes and season it all with flaky salt.
Cover the pan with wet parchment paper and aluminum foil.
Bake in the oven on 420F for 1 hour.
Remove the parchment paper and aluminum foil and bake in the oven for another 30 minutes.
Transfer to convection broil on 450F for 5-7 minutes to get a nice golden brown color.

name: Baba Ganoush- Roasted Eggplants with Tahini!

6. Garnish with chopped parsley, slices of chili peppers, drizzle of olive oil, and a bit of sumac.

name: RAS EL HANUT CHUCK ROAST!
ingredients: 3-hour slow cook chuck roast, seasoned with Ras El Hanut and lots of caramelized onions!
4 pounds of Chuck Roast, liberally seasoned with sea salt and black pepper
1 small celery root, peeled and cut to cubes
1 tablespoon of honey or date syrup
2. On medium heat, in a wide skillet pan, pour the olive oil and cumin seeds.
3. When the oil is hot add the chuck roast. Sear the chuck roast from both sides for about 3 minutes until it gets a nice golden brown color.
4. Take the beef out of the pan and put it aside.
5. Add to the same pan the onions, shallots, celery roots and garlic cloves.
6. Add the spices- Ras El Hanut, paprika, cumin, and salt. Saut√© it all for 5 minutes, stir occasionally.
7. Add the chuck roast back on top of the onions. Spread the mustard and honey on top of the chuck roast.
8. Pour the water to cover it all. Cover the pan with the lid.
9. Cook it for 30 minutes on the stove on medium heat.
10. Transfer to the oven on 300F / 150C for 3 hours.
11. After every hour check to see if the liquid covers the meat. If not add water.

name: SABA KADURIS RICE!
ingredients: 2 cups of basmati rice, rinsed and drained
1 large sweet onion, cut to thin circles
1. In a pot over medium heat, add the drained basmati rice, egg noodles, salt, turmeric, and olive oil. Mix for 1 minute.
2. Add 4 cups of boiling water, stir briefly, and cover with a lid. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 15 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, in a wide nonstick pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil, turmeric, and salt. Arrange the onion slices in a single layer over the oil.
4. Saut√© the onions for 2-3 minutes without stirring, until they become slightly golden.
5. Using a wide spoon, carefully spread the cooked rice evenly over the onion slices. Flatten the rice gently.
6. Cover with a lid and cook on low heat for 25 minutes.
7. To serve, place a wide plate over the pot, then carefully flip it over so the rice releases onto the plate.

name: AMBA CHICKEN AND RICE!

name: Kitchri- Iraqi rice and lentils!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil
1/3 cup of extra virgin olive oil
1 small onion or shallot, thinly sliced
1. Rinse the rice and the lentil and drain.
2. In a pot put the olive oil, add the drained rice and  lentil and salt.
3. On medium heat, mix the rice for 30 seconds.
4. Pour the boiling water and bring it to a boil.
5. Cover and reduce the heat to low heat. Cook it for 20 minutes.
6. In the meantime, ,in a pan add the olive oil, sliced onion, minced garlic and cumin.
7. Stir and fry on low heat for 4 minutes until it gets a nice golden color.
8. When the rice is ready, mix it gently and pour the cumin-garlic on top of the rice. M,ix it all gently.

name: THE EASIEST NO-BAKE CHEESECAKE!
ingredients: 1 package (250g) of tea biscuits. I used Osem petit beurre 8.8 oz
10 Fresh sliced strawberries and powdered sugar.
1. In a stand mixer with whisk attachment, add the heavy cream and powdered sugar. Blend it on medium speed for 4 minutes until a whipped cream is formed.
2. Add the Quark cheese using a spatula and mix it all gently together.
3. Put 1/2 cup of whole milk in a bowl that will fit the size of a biscuit.
4. Dip each biscuit in the milk for 3 seconds.
5. Place the biscuits in a ceramic cake pan (size around 8x11 inch) and make one layer of them.
6. Pour half of the cheese filling evenly on top of the biscuits.
7. Add another layer of the biscuits on top. No need to dip them in the milk this time.
8. Add the rest of the cheese filling on top of the biscuits and spread it evenly.
10. Store it in the refrigerator for 5 hours (overnight is great).
11. Sprinkle powdered sugar on top and serve it cold.
instructions: In a stand mixer with whisk attachment, add the heavy cream and powdered sugar. Blend it on medium speed for 4 minutes until a whipped cream is formed.
Add the Quark cheese using a spatula and mix it all gently together.
Put 1/2 cup of whole milk in a bowl that will fit the size of a biscuit.
Dip each biscuit in the milk for 3 seconds.
Place the biscuits in a ceramic cake pan (size around 8x11 inch) and make one layer of them.
Pour half of the cheese filling evenly on top of the biscuits.
Add another layer of the biscuits on top. No need to dip them in the milk this time.
Add the rest of the cheese filling on top of the biscuits and spread it evenly.
Decorate with the sliced strawberries.
Store it in the refrigerator for 5 hours (overnight is great).
Sprinkle powdered sugar on top and serve it cold.

name: MALABI!
ingredients: 4 cups almond milk (or any plant-based milk)
2 tablespoons rose water (or orange blossom water)
1. In a saucepan, whisk together almond milk, sugar, cornstarch, and salt.
2. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally for 7‚Äì8 minutes, until it thickens.
3. Remove from heat, stir in rose water.
4. Pour into 6 clear glasses. Let cool slightly, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight.
6. In a skillet over medium heat, combine all syrup ingredients. Cook until it bubbles and thickens slightly. Let it cool.
7. Before serving, spoon raspberry syrup over each Malabi cup and add your favorite toppings.

name: YOU MUST TRY THIS EGG SALAD!

name: VEGETARIAN CHOPPED LIVER!
ingredients: 4 hard boiled eggs, peeled and cut in half
1. Preheat the oven on high broil.
2. Put the eggplants on a baking sheet and score them with a knife.
3. Broil the eggplants on high broil for about 30-35 minutes until the skin is darkened and collapsing.
4. Meanwhile, heat a skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil, chopped onion, salt, and pepper. Stir, then let the onion fry for 2 minutes without stirring until it becomes translucent and yellow.
5. Continue frying for another 4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onion is caramelized and golden brown.
6. Once the eggplants are ready, transfer them to a cutting board. Scoop out the meat of the eggplants with a spoon leaving the skin out.
7. In a small food processor, combine the eggplant, fried onion (reserving 1 tablespoon for garnish), and garlic. Pulse 2-3 times.
8. Add the hard-boiled eggs and olive oil, then process until smooth.
9. Spread the eggplant mixture evenly onto a nice serving plate. Garnish with the reserved fried onion, a drizzle of olive oil, and flaky salt.

name: Ozney Haman - Hamantaschen time!
ingredients: 1 package of @kerrygoldusa unsalted butter 8 Oz (227g), cut to cubes
1. Put all the dough ingredients in a food processor.
2. Pulse it several times until it becomes a dough.
3. Make a ball from the dough and wrap it with a plastic wrap. Let it cool in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
5. On a floured surface, roll 1 part of the dough to a rectangle. Using a cookie cutter, make circles with a diameter of 3.5 inches.
6. Add a teaspoon of your favorite filling in the middle of each circle. I used date-caramel and chocolate spread fillings.
7. Close it tightly to a shape of a triangle.
8. Repeat the same method with the rest of the dough.
9. Arrange the hamantaschen on a baking sheet and put it in the freezer for 15 minutes. This will help the hamantaschen to not open during the baking.
10.  Bake it in a preheated oven on 375F / 180C for 15 minutes until the bottom of the hamantaschen is golden.
11. When it‚Äôs ready sprinkle powdered sugar on top.
instructions: Put all the dough ingredients in a food processor.
Pulse it several times until it becomes a dough.
Make a ball from the dough and wrap it with a plastic wrap. Let it cool in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Divide the dough into 3 parts.
On a floured surface, roll 1 part of the dough to a rectangle. Using a cookie cutter, make circles with a diameter of 3.5 inches.
Add a teaspoon of your favorite filling in the middle of each circle. I used date-caramel and chocolate spread fillings.
Close it tightly to a shape of a triangle.
Repeat the same method with the rest of the dough.
Arrange the hamantaschen on a baking sheet and put it in the freezer for 15 minutes. This will help the hamantaschen to not open during the baking.
Bake it in a preheated oven on 375F / 180C for 15 minutes until the bottom of the hamantaschen is golden.
When it‚Äôs ready sprinkle powdered sugar on top.

name: BEEF STEW WITH CHICKPEAS!
ingredients: 3 pounds of beef stew, cut to cubes
1. Powder the beef stew cubes with the flour.
2. On medium heat, in a wide skillet pan, pour the olive oil and add the sliced onions and garlic cloves. Stir for 1 minute.
3. Add the beef stew and sear it for about 2 minutes until it gets a nice golden brown color.
4. Season with: salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and Ras el Hanut. Stir the beef with all the spices.
5. Add the chickpeas, tomato paste, and date syrup and mix it all together.
6. Pour water to cover it all.
7. Cover with a lid and cook for 30 minutes on the stove on medium heat.
8. Transfer to the oven on 350F for 2.5-3 hours. After every hour check to see if the liquid covers the meat. If not add water.

name: SLOW-COOKED BEEF AND POTATOES!
ingredients: 3.5 pounds of Chuck Roast, liberally seasoned with sea salt and black pepper

name: SABA KADURIS RICE!
ingredients: 2 cups of basmati rice, rinsed and drained
1 large sweet onion, cut to thin circles
1. In a pot over medium heat, add the drained basmati rice, egg noodles, salt, turmeric, and olive oil. Mix for 1 minute.
2. Add 4 cups of boiling water, stir briefly, and cover with a lid. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 15 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, in a wide nonstick pan over medium heat, heat the olive oil, turmeric, and salt. Arrange the onion slices in a single layer over the oil.
4. Saut√© the onions for 2-3 minutes without stirring, until they become slightly golden.
5. Using a wide spoon, carefully spread the cooked rice evenly over the onion slices. Flatten the rice gently.
6. Cover with a lid and cook on low heat for 25 minutes.
7. To serve, place a wide plate over the pot, then carefully flip it over so the rice releases onto the plate.

name: CHICKEN MEATBALLS AND RICE NOODLES!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon of date syrup or honey
1 package of thin rice noodles 8.8 oz (250g)
1. In a mixing bowl, combine the ground chicken, shredded zucchini, shredded carrot, shredded onion, and chopped dill.
2. Season with: salt, pepper, turmeric, coriander, garlic powder, semolina flour, egg, olive oil, and date syrup.
3. Knead the mixture well with your hands until fully combined.
4. Wet your hands and shape the mixture into approximately 30 chicken meatballs.
5. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add olive oil. Place the chicken meatballs in the skillet and sear them on both sides for 5 minutes per side.
6. Let them cook on low heat for 15 minutes (no need to cover with a lid).
7. Add the rice noodles along with the liquid.
8. Gently mix everything together and let it cook over medium heat for an additional 5 minutes.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground chicken, shredded zucchini, shredded carrot, shredded onion, and chopped dill.

Wet your hands and shape the mixture into approximately 30 chicken meatballs.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and add olive oil. Place the chicken meatballs in the skillet and sear them on both sides for 5 minutes per side.
Let them cook on low heat for 15 minutes (no need to cover with a lid).
Add the rice noodles along with the liquid.
Gently mix everything together and let it cook over medium heat for an additional 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh dill.

name: RED CABBAGE SLAW WITH A TIP!
ingredients: 1 red cabbage, cut to half and then to thin slices
1. In a large bowl add the sliced cabbage and the salt.
2. Mix it well with your hands and squeeze the cabbage a bit. Let it sit for 5 minutes.
3. After 5 minutes you will see that the salt will draw out excess water from the cabbage and the cabbage will be soft. That will help preserve the crispiness.
4. Squeeze the cabbage from the liquid with your hands and add it to a new salad bowl.
5. Pour the dressing on top and mix it well.

name: Sfinge- Moroccan Hanukkah doughnuts!
ingredients: 1. In a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook, add the flour, dry yeast, sugar, and salt.
2. Blend the ingredients using low speed for 1 minute.
3. Add the water and mix for 3 minutes on medium-low speed until the dough is unified. The dough will be sticky - It‚Äôs ok.
4. With greased hands, knead the dough on a lightly greased surface.
5. Place the dough in a greased bowl and cover with a plastic wrap. Place it in warm spot for the dough to rise. Let it double in size for about an hour.
6. With greased hands, punch the dough to deflate it. Knead it a bit then cover and let it rise again for 30 minutes.
7. In a heavy-bottomed large pot, heat about 2-inch-high vegetable oil over medium heat until it reachees 338¬∞F / 170C on a thermometer.
8. Wet your hands with water from a bowl. Take a piece of dough the size of a tennis ball. Roll it to a ball, use your fingers to make a hole in the dough and gently stretch it into a ring.
9. Gently put it in the oil and fry it from both sides until golden. Repeat with the remaining dough.
10. When the Sfinge are ready roll it in the sugar before it cool off.
11. Arrange the Sfinge on a nice serving plate.

ingredients: 1 teaspoon of salt for the boiling water
6-7 cups of water to cover the cauliflower
1. In a large pot put the cauliflower florets with salt and cover with water.
2. On medium heat boil the cauliflower florets for about 15-20 minutes until they start to soften.
3. Drain the cauliflower and place them in a bowl.
4. Using a potato masher, roughly mash the cauliflower so it‚Äôs still chunky.
5. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix it all well.
6. Using an ice cream scoop sprayed with olive oil, scoop from the mixture and place on a baking sheet with a parchment paper.
7. Using a tablespoon, gently flatten each of the latkes.
8. Sprinkle sesame seeds and spray with olive oil.
9. In a preheated oven on 420F/220C, bake the latkes for 20 minutes.
10. Transfer to convection broil on 450F for 7-8 minutes to get a nice golden color.
11. Place the latkes on a nice plate, garnish with fresh parsley leaves, and serve it with Greek yogurt.

6. Spread the shredded mozzarella cheese over the pasta and sprinkle bread crumbs on top.
7. Return to the broil for 7-8 more minutes until the cheese is melted and slightly golden.

name: MALFOUF - IRAQI BAKLAVA CIGARS!
ingredients: 1 package of butter puff pastry, thawed
2. Divide the puff pastry dough into 2 parts.
3. On a baking paper dusted with flour, roll the puff pastry to a rectangular with size about 12 inch X 8.5 inch.
4. Save 4 tablespoons of the nut mixture aside for the topping.
5. Add half of the remaining nut mixture on top of the dough and spread it evenly.
6. Roll the dough, 2 rounds at a time, and cut with a knife (see the video). Continue with this method with the rest of the dough.
7. Repeat steps 5-6 with the second half of the dough.
9. On a greased ceramic pie pan, arrange the Malfouf (rolls) side by side.
10. Spread 4 tablespoons of the nuts mixture on top and at the sides of the Malfouf.
11. Bake it the oven on 400F for 25-30 minutes until the pastry is golden brown.
12. With a tablespoon, pour the orange blossom syrup evenly on top.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400F.
Divide the puff pastry dough into 2 parts.
On a baking paper dusted with flour, roll the puff pastry to a rectangular with size about 12 inch X 8.5 inch.
Save 4 tablespoons of the nut mixture aside for the topping.
Add half of the remaining nut mixture on top of the dough and spread it evenly.
Roll the dough, 2 rounds at a time, and cut with a knife (see the video). Continue with this method with the rest of the dough.
Repeat steps 5-6 with the second half of the dough.
You will get 9-10 rolls.
On a greased ceramic pie pan, arrange the Malfouf (rolls) side by side.
Spread 4 tablespoons of the nuts mixture on top and at the sides of the Malfouf.
Bake it the oven on 400F for 25-30 minutes until the pastry is golden brown.
With a tablespoon, pour the orange blossom syrup evenly on top.

name: JUICY CHICKEN KEBABS!
ingredients: 2. In a food processor add the green onions, garlic cloves, zucchini and a handful of parsley and cilantro. Pulse it 2-3 times.
3. Add 2 pieces of chicken breasts and pulse twice.
4. Add 2 more pieces of chicken breast and pulse again.
5. Add the rest of the ingredients and all the seasoning. Pulse it 2-3 times to get a unified mixture.
6. Using wet hands make oval shape kebabs from the chicken mixture and place them on a baking pan. You will get about 30 kebabs.
7. Spray avocado oil on top of the kebabs and sprinkle flaky salt.
8. Bake in a preheated oven on 420F for 25 minutes, then transfer to convection broil on 450F for 7-8 minutes to get a nice golden color.
9. Serve it on a nice plate with a drizzle of tahini, fresh herbs and a touch of sumac.

name: JUICY BEEF ARAYES!
ingredients: 1. In a large bowl combine all the beef mixture ingredients. Knead the beef mixture for at least 5 minutes with wet hands.
2. Open up each pita half and stuff it with a handful of the ground beef mixture.
3. On the stove on medium heat, pour 5 tablespoons of olive oil into a grilling pan.
4. Fry each stuffed pita face down for 4 minutes until it gets a nice brown color.

6. Spray olive oil on top of the pitas.
7. Transfer to a preheated oven on 420F for 20 more minutes.
8. Serve it hot on a nice plate topped with tahini dressing, sumac onions, chopped parsley, and Amba sauce.

name: HARISSA-HONEY CHICKEN AND SWEET POTATOES!
ingredients: 2 sweet onions, cut to halves and sliced
4-5 small sweet potatoes, cut to quarters
1. On a skillet pan on medium heat, pour the olive oil. Add the salt, pepper, and paprika.

3. Add the garlic cloves and the chicken thighs on top. Fry them from both sides to get a nice color.

8. Garnish with chopped cilantro and flaky salt.

name: ROSH HASHANAH BRISKET!
ingredients: 1/2 celery root, peeled and cut to slices
4 pitted Medjool dates, cut to halves
1. Season the brisket with flaky salt and ground pepper from both sides.
2. on a skillet pan (size 5 quarts), on medium heat, drizzle olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the brisket on top.
3. Sear the brisket from both sides for about 3 minutes until it gets a nice golden brown color.
4. Take the brisket out of the pan and put it aside.
5. Add to the same pan the pearl onions, shallots, carrots, beets, celery roots, garlic cloves, and dates.
6. Season with salt, pepper and paprika and saut√© for 5 minutes. Stir occasionally.
7. Add the brisket back on top of the veggies.
8. Pour the date sauce on top of the brisket. Add the water to cover it all.
9. Cover the pan with a lid and cook it for 30 minutes on the stove on a medium heat.
10. Transfer to the oven on 300F / 150C for 4 hours.
11. After every hour check to see if the liquid covers the meat. If not add water.

name: STUFFED PEPPERS!

name: RED CABBAGE SLAW WITH A TIP!
ingredients: 1 red cabbage, cut to half and then to thin slices
1. In a large bowl add the sliced cabbage and the salt.
2. Mix it well with your hands and squeeze the cabbage a bit. Let it sit for 5 minutes.
3. After 5 minutes you will see that the salt will draw out excess water from the cabbage and the cabbage will be soft. That will help preserve the crispiness.
4. Squeeze the cabbage from the liquid with your hands and add it to a new salad bowl.
5. Pour the dressing on top and mix it well.

name: THE EASIEST NO-BAKE CHEESECAKE!

3. Put 1/2 cup of whole milk in a bowl that will fit the size of a biscuit.

10. Store it in the refrigerator for 5 hours (overnight is great).
11. Sprinkle powdered sugar on top and serve it cold.

name: VEGAN POTATO GRATIN!
ingredients: 10-12 golden potatoes, peeled and cut to thin slices in a mandolin

2 tablespoons of olive oil (for the bottom)
2 tablespoons of olive oil (for the top)
2. In an oven-safe pan, greased with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of flaky salt.
3. Place 3 layers of potato slices. Between each layer, spray olive oil and sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of flaky salt.
4. On the top layer, drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon of flaky salt, and fresh oregano leaves.
5. Cover with wet parchment paper and aluminum foil.
6. Bake in the oven on 420F for 50 minutes.
7. Remove the cover and transfer to convection broil on 450F for 7-8 minutes to get a nice golden crust.

name: FESTIVE BRISKET!
ingredients: 1/2 celery root, peeled and cut to slices
4 pitted Medjool dates, cut to halves
1. Season the brisket with flaky salt and ground pepper from both sides.
2. on a skillet pan (size 5 quarts), on medium heat, drizzle olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the brisket on top.
3. Sear the brisket from both sides for about 3 minutes until it gets a nice golden brown color.
4. Take the brisket out of the pan and put it aside.
5. Add to the same pan the pearl onions, shallots, carrots, beets, celery roots, garlic cloves, and dates.
6. Season with salt, pepper and paprika and saut√© for 5 minutes. Stir occasionally.
7. Add the brisket back on top of the veggies.
8. Pour the date sauce on top of the brisket. Add the water to cover it all.
9. Cover the pan with a lid and cook it for 30 minutes on the stove on a medium heat.
10. Transfer to the oven on 300F / 150C for 3.5 hours.
11. After every hour check to see if the liquid covers the meat. If not add water.

name: VEGETARIAN CHOPPED LIVER!
ingredients: 4 hard boiled eggs, peeled and cut to halves
1. Put the eggplants on a baking sheet and score them with a knife.
2. Broil the eggplants on high broil for about 30-35  minutes until the skin is darker and collapsing.
3. On a skillet pan on medium heat pour the olive oil, add the chopped onion, salt, and pepper.
4. Stir it all and let the onion fry for 2 minutes without stirring. The onion should become clear and yellow.
5. Fry it for 4 more minutes. Stir occasionally until the onion becomes caramelized and brown.
6. When the eggplants are ready, place them on a cutting board. Scoop out the meat of the eggplants with a spoon leaving the skin out.
7. In a small food processor, place the eggplants, fried onion (leave 1 tablespoon for garnish), and 1 garlic clove.
8. Pulse it 2-3 times. Add the hard boiled eggs and olive oil.
9. Process it until the texture is smooth.
10. On a nice plate, spread the eggplant spread evenly and garnish with fried onion, drizzle of olive oil, and flaky salt.

name: LEMONY MOROCCAN MEATBALLS!

name: Ozney Haman - Hamantaschen time!
ingredients: 1. Put all the dough ingredients in a food processor.
2. Pulse it several times until it becomes a dough.
3. Make a ball from the dough and wrap it with a plastic wrap. Let it cool in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
5. On a floured surface, roll 1 part of the dough to a rectangle. Using a cookie cutter, make circles with a diameter of 3.5 inches.
6. Add a teaspoon of your favorite filling in the middle of each circle. I used date-caramel and chocolate spread fillings.
7. Close it tightly to a shape of a triangle.
8. Repeat the same method with the rest of the dough.
9. Arrange the hamantaschen on a baking sheet and put it in the freezer for 15 minutes. This will help the hamantaschen to not open during the baking.
10. Bake it in a preheated oven on 375F / 180C for 15 minutes until the bottom of the hamantaschen is golden.
11. When it‚Äôs ready sprinkle powdered sugar on top.
instructions: Put all the dough ingredients in a food processor.

Divide the dough into 3 parts.
On a floured surface, roll 1 part of the dough to a rectangle. Using a cookie cutter, make circles with a diameter of 3.5 inches.
Add a teaspoon of your favorite filling in the middle of each circle. I used date-caramel and chocolate spread fillings.
Close it tightly to a shape of a triangle.
Repeat the same method with the rest of the dough.
Arrange the hamantaschen on a baking sheet and put it in the freezer for 15 minutes. This will help the hamantaschen to not open during the baking.
Bake it in a preheated oven on 375F / 180C for 15 minutes until the bottom of the hamantaschen is golden.
When it‚Äôs ready sprinkle powdered sugar on top.

name: ROASTED EGGPLANT AND PEPPER SALAD!

name: TURMERIC CHICKEN MEATBALLS!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon of honey or date syrup
3 celery sticks with the leaves, chopped
1. Put all the chicken meatballs ingredients in a bowl.
2. Knead it well with your hands until everything is combined. Wet your hands and make around 30 chicken meatballs.
3. On medium heat on a skillet pan, pour the olive oil, salt, turmeric, pepper, and cumin seeds. Stir them all together for 1 minute.
4. Add the onions, celery, and potatoes. Mix them well for 1 minute.
5. Add the peas and pour 4 cups of water. Stir and let it cook for 10 minutes.

7. Cover with a lid and cook it on low heat for 50 minutes.
8. Remove the cover and transfer to convection broil on 450F for 8-10 minutes to get a nice golden color.

name: CHOCOLATE BALLS- KADOREI SHOKOLAD!
ingredients: 1 package (250g) of tea biscuits. I used Osem petit beurre 8.8 oz
1 cup of heavy cream OR 1 cup of coconut cream
1 package of dark chocolate morsels 70% cacao
1. Put the biscuits in a sealable plastic bag (Ziploc) and close tightly. Using a rolling pin, crush the biscuits roughly.
2. In a bowl, put the chocolate chips and heavy cream and transfer to the microwave for 1 minute until the chocolate is melting.
3. Mix it all together to get a chocolaty mixture.
4. Add the almond butter to the chocolate mixture and mix well.
5. Pour the crushed biscuits and mix them all together.
6. Cover the bowl with a plastic wrap and refrigerate for 20 minutes.
7. Spread the shredded coconut in a bowl.
8. Make chocolate balls from the chocolate mixture.
9. Coat the balls with the coconut by rolling them from side to side. Place them on a serving tray.
10. You can enjoy immediately or refrigerate it.

name: STUFFED PEPPERS!

name: MALFOUF - IRAQI BAKLAVA!

name: BAKED CAULIFLOWER LATKE!
ingredients: 1 teaspoon of salt for the boiling water
6-7 cups of water to cover the cauliflower
1. In a large pot put the cauliflower florets with salt and cover with water.
2. On medium heat boil the cauliflower florets for about 15-20 minutes until they start to soften.
3. Drain the cauliflower and place them in a bowl.
4. Using a potato masher, roughly mash the cauliflower so it‚Äôs still chunky.
5. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix it all well.

8. Sprinkle sesame seeds and spray with olive oil.
9. In a preheated oven on 420F/220C, bake the latkes for 20 minutes.
10. Transfer to convection broil on 450F for 7-8 minutes to get a nice golden color.
11. Place the latkes on a nice plate, garnish with fresh parsley leaves, and serve it with Greek yogurt.

name: NY STRIP STEAK WITH GREEN SCHUG!

1 jalape√±o pepper, cut to stripes without the seeds
1. Let the steaks rest in room temperature for 30 minutes.
2. Season the steaks with salt, pepper, and garlic powder from both sides.
3. On high heat on a grilling pan sprayed with cooking oil, place the steaks.

7. Using a tablespoon pour the green Schug on top of the steaks.
8. Sprinkle flaky salt and drizzle olive oil on top.

instructions:
Recipe:
Ingredients-

Cover tightly with aluminum foil
Bake in the oven for 40 minutes
Remove the aluminum foil and parchment paper and bake for extra 10 minutes

name: CHRAIME- MOROCCAN FISH!
ingredients: 6 fillets (3 pounds) of @krudofish fresh kosher Grouper
4-5 slices of lemon without the seeds
1. On a skillet pan, put the spices and the olive oil.
2. On medium heat, ‚Äúopen‚Äù the spices for 1 minutes and mix them together.
3. Add the tomatoes, red peppers, garlic cloves, lemon slices, and dried chili peppers. Mix them all with the spices.
4. Add 1 tablespoon of tomato paste and mix it with the veggies.
5. Pour 3/4 cup of water, stir, and cover with a lid.
6. Cook it on low heat for 10 minutes.
7. Add the fresh grouper fillets on top of the sauce.
8. Using a tablespoon, add some of the sauce from the pan over the fish.
9. Add chopped cilantro, parsley, and precooked chickpeas around the fish fillets.
10. Pour the red oil on top of the fish fillets.
11. Cover with a lid and let it cook for 25 minutes on low heat.
12. Remove the lid and transfer to convection broil on 450F for 5-7 minutes to get a nice color.

name: SLOW-COOKED LONDON BROIL AND POTATO!
ingredients: 3 pounds of @lchaimmeats Bison London Broil, seasoned with salt and ground pepper
2. On medium heat, in a wide oven-safe skillet pan, pour the olive oil.
3. When the oil is hot add the London Broil cuts.
4. Sear the meat from both sides for about 3 minutes until it gets a nice golden brown color.
5. Add to the same pan the baby potatoes, shallots, garlic cloves, and fresh rosemary leaves.
6. Pour the sauce on top and cover with a lid.
7. Transfer to the oven on 360F for 2 hours.
8. After 1 hour check to see if the liquid covers the meat. If not add water.
9. Remove the lid and roast on convection broil at 450F for 5-7 minutes to get a nice color.
10. Garnish with parsley or rosemary leaves.

name: BAKED MEDITERRANEAN FETA PASTA!
ingredients: 1 package (250 grams) of any pasta you like, cooked in salty water and drained
200 grams of feta cheese, cut to cubes
1. Preheat the oven to 450F convection broil.
2. In an oven safe pan, place the tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, basil and the feta cheese.
3. Season with salt, olive oil and mix it all.
4. Broil in the oven for about 15 minutes until the tomatoes are soft and the cheese is melted.
5. Remove the pan from the oven and add cottage cheese, mix it together.
6. Add the cooked pasta and mix it all together.
7. Spread the shredded mozzarella cheese over the pasta.
8. Place the sliced mushrooms and fresh basil on top.
9. Return to the broil for 10 more minutes until the cheese is melted and slightly golden.

name: ROUND HONEY BRIOCHE CHALLAH!
ingredients: 1. In a stand mixer with a dough hook, put the flour, yeast, sugar and blend it for 2 minutes.
2. Add the eggs, soft butter and honey and blend it for 2 more minutes.
3. Add the salt and water and blend it for 5 minutes.
4. If you feel the dough needs a little bit more water or flour, you can add it.
5. Cover the dough with a towel or plastic wrap and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until it doubles in size.
6. Divide the dough to 3 even parts. We will use 1 part for our challah.
8. Roll each ball to a strand and make the round shape challah as shown in the video.
9. Transfer to a baking sheet and let it rise for 40 minutes.
10. Whisk 1 egg + 1 tablespoon of water + 1 tablespoon of honey and brush the challah.
11. Sprinkle sliced almonds or sesame seeds on top of the challah.
12. Bake it in a preheated oven on 400F for 20 minutes or until it‚Äôs golden and ready!
13. When the challah is ready, brush it with olive oil to get a shiny look.
instructions: In a stand mixer with a dough hook, put the flour, yeast, sugar and blend it for 2 minutes.

name: JUICY BISON CHUCK ROAST!
ingredients: 6-7 pounds of @lchaimmeats Bison Chuck Roast, liberally seasoned with sea salt and black pepper
3 small red onions, cut to halves
1 tablespoon of honey or date syrup
5 cups of warm water to cover
2. On medium heat, in a wide skillet pan, pour the olive oil and cumin seeds.
3. When the oil is hot add the bison chuck roast.
4. Sear the chuck roast from both sides for about 3 minutes until it gets a nice golden brown color.
5. Take the chuck roast out of the pan and put it aside.
6. Add to the same pan the onions and garlic cloves and mix them well.
7. Add the spices- Ras El Hanut, paprika, turmeric and salt.
8. Saut√© it all for 5 minutes, stir occasionally.
9. Add back the chuck roast on top of the onions and spread the pitted dates.
10. Spread the spicy mustard and date syrup on top of the chuck roast.
11. Pour the water to cover it all. Cover the pan with the lid.
12. Cook it for 30 minutes on the stove on medium heat.
13. Transfer to oven on 300F/ 150C for 3 hours. After each hour check to see if the liquid covers the meat. If not add water.
14. Garnish with pomegranate seeds and parsley leaves.

name: CHARRED EGGPLANT CARPACCIO!
ingredients: 1 jalape√±o pepper, cut to strips without the seeds
1. Preheat the oven on high broil.
2. Put the eggplants on a baking sheet and score them with a knife.
3. Roast the eggplants for about 30-35  minutes until the skin is darker and collapsing.
4. On a cutting board, scoop out the filling of the eggplants with a spoon, leave the skin out.
5. Using a knife, chop the eggplants until it is slightly mashed.
6. On a nice round plate, using a fork, spread the eggplant mixture and drizzle some of the green schug on top.
7. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of Silan and garnish with mint leaves, pomegranate seeds, flaky salt and finish it with a drizzle of olive oil.

name: LEMONY ZAATAR CHICKEN!

name: TURMERIC BASMATI RICE!
ingredients: Add 2 cups of rice and stir it all until the rice gets the yellow color.
Add 4 cups of boiling water and stir gently.
instructions:
Recipe:
Ingredients-
2 cups of basmati rice 
1 cup of fine egg noodles 
5 tablespoons of olive oil 
1 chopped shallot 
1 teaspoon of turmeric 
1 teaspoon of ground coriander 
1 teaspoon of salt 
4 cups of boiling water 

Garnish- handful of chopped dill and cilantro leaves 

Method- 
On a skillet pan on medium heat, put the olive oil
Add the turmeric, coriander and salt
Stir for 2 minutes to ‚Äúopen‚Äù the flavors
Add the chopped shallots and stir for 1 minute
Add the egg noodles and stir for 1 minute
Add 2 cups of rice and stir it all until the rice gets the yellow color
Add 4 cups of boiling water and stir gently
Cover with a lid and cook for 20 minutes on low heat
Let the rice sit for 5 minutes before you serve

name: YOU MUST TRY THIS EGG SALAD!

6. Add the caramelized onion with its oil.
8. Garnish with chopped dill and sumac.

name: MALFOUF - IRAQI BAKLAVA!
ingredients: 1 package of butter puff pastry, thawed
2. Divide the puff pastry dough into 2 parts.
3. On a baking paper dusted with flour, roll the puff pastry to a rectangular with size about 12 inch X 8.5 inch.
4. Save 4 tablespoons of the nut mixture aside for the topping.
5. Add half of the remaining nut mixture on top of the dough and spread it evenly.
6. Roll the dough, 2 rounds at a time, and cut with a knife (see the video). Continue with this method with the rest of the dough.
7. Repeat steps 5-6 with the second half of the dough.
9. On a greased ceramic pie pan, arrange the Malfouf (rolls) side by side.
10. Spread 4 tablespoons of the nuts mixture on top and at the sides of the Malfouf.
11. Bake it the oven on 400F for 25-30 minutes until the pastry is golden brown.
12. With a tablespoon, pour the orange blossom syrup evenly on top.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400F.
Divide the puff pastry dough into 2 parts.
On a baking paper dusted with flour, roll the puff pastry to a rectangular with size about 12 inch X 8.5 inch.
Save 4 tablespoons of the nut mixture aside for the topping.
Add half of the remaining nut mixture on top of the dough and spread it evenly.
Roll the dough, 2 rounds at a time, and cut with a knife (see the video). Continue with this method with the rest of the dough.
Repeat steps 5-6 with the second half of the dough.
You will get 9-10 rolls.
On a greased ceramic pie pan, arrange the Malfouf (rolls) side by side.
Spread 4 tablespoons of the nuts mixture on top and at the sides of the Malfouf.
Bake it the oven on 400F for 25-30 minutes until the pastry is golden brown.
With a tablespoon, pour the orange blossom syrup evenly on top.

name: CHALLAH BREAD PUDDING!
ingredients: 1/2 tablespoon of soft unsalted butter for greasing the pan.
1. On a medium heat on a saucepan, put the milk, heavy cream, light brown sugar, butter and vanilla extract.
2. Stir it until the butter is melted. Let it cool for 10 minutes.
3. Add the eggs, one at a time, and whisk it quickly after each egg.
4. Grease with the soft butter a round pie pan and sprinkle the brown sugar.
6. Pour the butter mixture evenly and sprinkle cinnamon and vanilla sugar on top.
7. Bake in the oven on 400F for 30 minutes, or until the top is crispy and brown but the inside is still a little wobbly. (this is the secret for the best bread pudding).
8. Sprinkle powered sugar on top and serve it warm.

4. Grill each stuffed pita face down for 4 minutes until it gets a nice brown color.
5. Then grill the sides for 3 minutes on each side.
6. Spray olive oil on top of the pitas.
7. Transfer to a preheated oven on 420F for 10 more minutes.
8. Serve it hot on a nice plate topped with tahini dressing, sumac onions, chopped parsley and amba sauce.
instructions: In a large bowl combine all the chicken mixture ingredients. Knead the chicken mixture for at least 5 minutes with wet hands.
Open up each pita half and stuff it with the ground chicken mixture.
On the stove on medium heat, pour 5 tablespoons of olive oil into a grilling pan.
Grill each stuffed pita face down for 4 minutes until it gets a nice brown color.
Then grill the sides for 3 minutes on each side.
Spray olive oil on top of the pitas.
Transfer to a preheated oven on 420F for 10 more minutes.
Serve it hot on a nice plate topped with tahini dressing, sumac onions, chopped parsley and amba sauce.

instructions:
Recipe:
Ingredients-
2 cups of basmati rice 
1 package of frozen peas (450g), defrosted in room temperature for 5 minutes
1 teaspoon of salt 
1 teaspoon of turmeric 
1/2 teaspoon of cumin
Zest from 1 lemon 
1/4 cup of olive oil 
4 cups of boiling water

Method-
Preheat the oven to 400F 
In an oven safe pan, pour the rice and peas
Season with salt, turmeric, cumin, lemon zest and olive oil
Add 4 cups of boiling water and mix to make sure the rice is covered
Put wet parchment paper on top of the pan
Cover tightly with aluminum foil
Bake in the oven for 40 minutes
Remove the aluminum foil and parchment paper and bake for extra 10 minutes

name: RAS EL HANUT BEEF HASH!
ingredients: 3 pounds of ground beef 90% lean / 10% fat (1.5 kg)
1/2 celery root, peeled and finely chopped to cubes
1 carrot, finely chopped to small cubes
2 ripe vine tomatoes, cut to thin circles
1 baby eggplant, cut to thin circles
1. On medium heat in a large pot, pour the olive oil.
2. Add the spices: turmeric, coriander, and Ras El Hanut. Stir with the oil and ‚Äúopen‚Äù the spices for 30 seconds.
3. Add the veggies and saut√© with the spices for 1 minutes.
4. Move the veggies to the edges of the pot and place the ground beef in the middle.
5. Break up the meat with a wooden spoon, until meat is no longer pink, for 5 to 10 minutes.
6. Season with salt, pepper, tomato paste, date syrup and minced garlic. Mix it all with the beef.
7. Add the chickpeas and cilantro and mix it with the beef.
8. Pour 3/4 cup of water and stir it gently with the beef.
9. Place the tomato slices in the outer circle of the pot and the eggplant slices in the inner circle.
10. Let it cook for 10 minutes on low heat.
11. Transfer to convection broil on 450F for 10 minutes to get a nice golden brown color.

Add the turmeric, coriander and salt

Add the chopped shallots and stir for 1 minute
Add the egg noodles and stir for 1 minute

Let the rice sit for 5 minutes before you serve

name: MAKLUBA- IRQI RICE! follow ruhamasfood for more!

instructions:
Recipe:
Ingredients-
8-10  peppers any color

Filling for the peppers-
*this filling can be perfect for any stuffed vegetables*
2.5 cups of basmati rice
Handful of chopped cilantro, parsley and dill
1 chopped shallot
3 minced garlic cloves 
Zest from 1 lemon
4 tablespoons of tomato paste
2 shredded carrots or 1 sweet potato 
2 grated vine tomatoes 
4 tablespoons of olive oil
2 tablespoons of date syrup 
1 tablespoon of kosher salt 
1/2 teaspoon of paprika 
1/2 teaspoon of black pepper 
1/2 teaspoon of cumin 
1 teaspoon of sumac 
1 tablespoon of fresh or dried mint
Mix all the filling ingredients in a bowl

Tomatoes sauce-
5 tablespoons of tomato paste 
2 tablespoons of date syrup 
1 tablespoon of pomegranate molasses 
7 cups of boiled water 
Juice from 1 lemon 
1 teaspoon of salt
1 teaspoon of paprika 
In a bowl mix all the sauce ingredients 

Method- 
-Cut thin slice from the stem end of each pepper and remove the top
We will use the top later to cover the stuffed pepper
Remove the seeds, wash and dry the  peppers
-Place the peppers close to each other
-On a medium heat, cook the peppers without the sauce for 3 minutes

-Pour the tomato sauce gently over the peppers 
-Let it cook on medium heat for 20 minutes
-Cook it for additional 1.5 hours on low heat
-Transfer to the oven on low broil for 5-10 minutes to get a nice tan color to the peppers

Let the yeast work for 30 seconds , it should rise a bit

Powdered sugar
Chocolate ganache

Method- 
In a stand mixer put the flour, add the yeast, 1/2 cup of sugar and mix it for 2 minutes 
Add the eggs, butter, vanilla, brandy and salt
Blend  it for 2 minutes

Add the water and blend  it for 5 minutes 
If you feel the dough needs a little bit more water or flour you can add it
Cover the dough with a towel and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour, until it almost doubles in size
Place the each dough ball on a parchment paper square, cover with a towel and let it rise for 45 minutes

Frying the sufganiot- 
In a heavy-bottomed medium pot, heat about 2-inch high of vegetable oil over medium heat until it reaches 338¬∞F / 170C on a thermometer
Allow to fry for about 2 minutes or until golden, then flip them over to cook the other side
Once the doughnuts have cooled a bit, poke a hole on top and fill with the jelly, powder with sugar powder

name: ZANGULA-  Iraqi Spiral Fried Dough!
ingredients: 1 tablespoon of orange and lemon peals.
instructions:
Zangula- 
Ingredients- 
1 tablespoon of dry yeast 
1 teaspoon of sugar
1/4 cup of lukewarm water
Mix the yeast, sugar and water in small bowl
Let the yeast start to rise for about 30 seconds

1 cup of water 
Bring the syrup ingredients to a boil in a saucepan, lower the flame and cook for about 10 minutes until the syrup thickens slightly

Method- 
For the dough- 
In a stand mixer with guitar hook, put the yeast, water and sugar blend it together for 1 minute
Add the vanilla extract and the flour
Blend it for 5 minutes for a smooth mixture
Cover the dough and let it double its size  for an hour
After 1 hour ,stir the dough and let it rise again for 15 minutes
Stir again and let it rise for 15 more minutes for the third time
Heat oil for semi-deep frying in a wide pan

name: CHOCOLATE BRIOCHE ROSES CAKE!
instructions:
üç´üç´
Let‚Äôs start the weekend with something sweet

Recipeüëá
Ingredients-
Let‚Äôs start with the yeast- 
1 1/4 tablespoons of dry yeast 
1 tablespoon of sugar 
1/4 cup of lukewarm water 
Mix the dry yeast, sugar and the water
Let the yeast work for 30 seconds, the mixture should rise

5 1/2 cups of all purpose flour 
1/2 cup of sugar 
1 stick of soft butter (4 ounces) 
2 eggs
1/4 teaspoon of salt 
1 1/4 cups of lukewarm water

Chocolate filling- I used @wholefoods hazelnut cocoa spread

(Nutella or any other chocolate spread will be great)

Sugar water-
1/4 cup of sugar 
1 tablespoon of vanilla sugar
1/2 cup of water
On a medium heat put the ingredients in a small pan and mix it until the sugar is melt

Method-
In a stand mixer with a dough hook, put the flour, yeast, sugar and blend it for 2 minutes 
Add the eggs, soft butter and honey and blend it for 2 more minutes

Add the salt and water and blend it for 5 minutes 
If you feel the dough needs a little bit more water or flour, you can add it
Cover the dough with a towel or plastic wrap and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until it doubles in size
Spread the chocolate evenly
Place the rolls onto a greased baking sheet

name: Round Honey Brioche Challah!
instructions:
Follow @ruhamasfood for more‚ù§Ô∏è
‚≠êÔ∏èLet me know in the comments which recipes you would like to see for the upcoming holiday!üëáRecipe for my challah is below

Let‚Äôs start with the yeast- 
1 1/4 tablespoons of dry yeast 
1 tablespoon of sugar 
1/4 cup of lukewarm water 
Mix the dry yeast, sugar and the water
Let the yeast work for 30 seconds, the mixture should rise

Method-
In a stand mixer with a dough hook, put the flour, yeast, sugar and blend it for 2 minutes 
Add the eggs, soft butter and honey and blend it for 2 more minutes

Add the salt and water and blend it for 5 minutes 
If you feel the dough needs a little bit more water or flour, you can add it
Cover the dough with a towel or plastic wrap and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until it doubles in size
Transfer to a baking sheet and let it rise for 40 minutes
Sprinkle sliced almond or sesame seeds on top of the challah
Bake it in a preheated oven on 375F / 180C
Bake it for 20-25 minutes or until golden and ready

name: Baharat Baked Chicken and Rice!
ingredients: 6-8 pieces of boneless and skinless chicken thighs
instructions:
Recipe:
Ingredients-

name: THE QUEEN OF ALL  ROASTED CAULIFLOWER WITH GREEN TAHINI!!! RECIPE
instructions:
Method- 
Preheat the oven to 430F / 220C
Fill hot water in a pot, add 1 teaspoon of salt and boil the cauliflower
Cook for around 10 minutes in the boiling water, depending on the size of the cauliflower, until it becomes soft but not too soft
Drain the water and place the cauliflower on a baking dish
Season the cauliflower with 1/2 teaspoon of maldon salt and drizzle some olive oil
Bake it for 20- 25 minutes until the top turns golden brown
Transfer the cauliflower to a nice plate
Drizzle the green tahini on top and add some chopped parsley or cilantro

name: Meatless Monday Calls For Shakshuka!
ingredients: 5 fresh vine tomatoes, cut to quarters
1 tablespoon of brown sugar or honey
instructions:
Ingredients- 
6-8 organic eggs 
5 tablespoons of olive oil 
5 fresh vine tomatoes, cut to quarters
5 sliced garlic cloves
2 tablespoons of chopped cilantro 
1/2 tablespoon of kosher salt 
1/2 teaspoon of black pepper 
1/2 tablespoon of paprika 
1 teaspoon of cumin
1 tablespoon of brown sugar or honey 
2 tablespoons of tomato paste
1/3 cup of water

Method- 
In a skillet pan on medium heat pour the olive oil
Put the tomatoes and simmer them until they are starting to get soft and reddish for about 5 minutes
Add garlic, tomato paste, salt, pepper, paprika, cumin, sugar (or honey) and water
Let it cook for 10 minutes on low heat
Season the eggs with salt flakes and fresh black pepper
Spread chopped fresh cilantro on top
Let it cook for 10-15 more minutes on low heat
Serve it on heavenly piece of toasted challah!!

instructions:
Stuffed Peppers:
Ingredients-
8-10  peppers any color

Filling for the pepper-
*this filling can be perfect for any stuffed vegetables*
2.5 cups of basmati rice
Handful of chopped cilantro,parsley and dill
1/4 chopped shallots 
3 minced garlic cloves 
Zest from 1 lemon
4 tablespoons of tomato paste
2 shredded carrots 
2 grated vine tomatoes 
4 tablespoons of olive oil
2 tablespoons of date syrup 
1 tablespoon of kosher salt 
1/2 teaspoon of paprika 
1/2 teaspoon of black pepper 
1/2 teaspoon of cumin 
1 teaspoon of sumac 
1 tablespoon of fresh or dried mint
In a bowl mix all the filling ingredients

Tomatoes sauce-
5 tablespoons of tomato paste 
2 tablespoons of date syrup 
1 tablespoon of pomegranate molasses 
7 cups of boiled water 
Juice from 1 lemon 
1 teaspoon of salt
1 teaspoon of paprika 
In a bowl mix all the sauce ingredients 

Method- 
Cut thin slice from the stem end of each pepper and remove the top
We will use the top later to cover the stuffed pepper
Remove the seeds, wash and dry the  peppers
Place the peppers close to each other
On a medium heat, cook them without the sauce for 3 minutes

Pour the sauce gently over the peppers 
Let it cook on medium heat for 20 minutes, 
And then cook it for 1 hour and 20 minutes more on low heat
Transfer to the oven on low broil for 5-10 minutes to get a nice tan color to the peppers

name: BEEF KEBABS With a SECRET INGREDIENT
ingredients: 1 bunch of cilantro, washed and dried
1 small golden potato, cut to quarters

instructions:
Recipe:
Ingredients-
For the Kebab-
2 pounds of ground beef 85/15
1 bunch of cilantro, washed and dried
1 small golden potato, cut to quarters 
5 garlic cloves
1/4 celery root, peeled and cut to half 
1 shallot, cut to quarters

For the Kebab seasoning-
1 teaspoon of sea salt
1/2 teaspoon of ground black pepper 
1 teaspoon of cumin 
1 teaspoon of paprika 
1 teaspoon of Ras el hanout
5 tablespoons of olive oil

For the pan: 
3 tablespoons of olive oil 
1 sweet onion, sliced to circles 
7-8 celery sticks, cut to quarters 
1/4 teaspoon of salt 
1 tablespoon of date syrup 

Chickpeas mixture- 
1 can of precooked chickpeas, drained 
1 tablespoon of tomato paste
2 minced garlic cloves
1/2 teaspoon of salt 
2 tablespoons of olive oil
1/2 cup of boiled water
Put all the ingredients in a bowl and mix it well
-put the ground beef in a bowl, add the ground veggies and season with all the Kebab spices
-On medium heat in a skillet pan, pour the olive oil and saut√© the onion and the celery sticks for 4 minutes, season with salt
-Add the kebabs in 2 circles
-Drizzle the date syrup and add the chickpeas mixture on top
-Let it cook on low heat for 40 minutes
-Transfer it for 10-15 minutes to the oven on low broil for a nice golden tan color

instructions:

Stir-fry recipe
Ingredients-

1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ginger powder
3 minced garlic cloves 
1 tablespoon of honey

Stir fry sauce- 
1 tablespoon of honey 
1/4 cup of stir fry soy-free sauce 
1 tablespoon of tamari soy sauce
1 teaspoon of ginger powder 
1 teaspoon of salt
1 teaspoon of black pepper 
Juice from 1 lime
1 tablespoon of olive oil
1 teaspoon of sesame oil
In a bowl mix all the ingredients

Method- 
In a wide pan on medium heat, put 1 tablespoon of olive oil
Pour all the veggies into the same pan and stir them well for 5 minutes
Add the seared chicken and mix together
Add the precooked rice noodles
Pour the sauce on top of everything and mix it all well
Let it cook on low heat for 15 minutes

name: BEST PITA BREAD!!!RECIPE
instructions:
4 cups of all purpose flour
2 teaspoons of dry yeast
4 teaspoons of sugar
1/2 teaspoon of salt
5 tablespoons of olive oil
1 1/2 cups of lukewarm water

Method-
In a small bowl put the dry yeast, 1/4 teaspoon of sugar and 1/4 lukewarm water, mix it and wait 2 minutes

In a stand mixer with a dough hook, put the flour, yeast mixture and the sugar
Blend it for 2 minutes
Add the olive oil, water and salt
Blend it for 4 minutes
Cover the dough and let it rest for 40 minutes in a warm place

Let them rise for 20 minutes
Put it in the preheated oven on 520F
After 3-4 minutes you will see the magic happen and the pita will have bubbles, this is the pocket , it‚Äôs time to flip the pita and bake it just for 1 more minute

name: BEST CHICKEN EVER!
ingredients: 1 lemon or lime  peeled ‚Äã‚Äãand sliced without seeds
instructions:
Ingredients for the Chicken marinade:
1/4 cup olive oil
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
3 minced garlic cloves 
1 tablespoon date syrup @thedatelady 
1 teaspoon paprika
1 teaspoon sumac @williamssonoma 
1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
1/4 teaspoon cumin
1/2 teaspoon grated ginger or powder
ü•ò Mix all the ingredients in a small bowl 

Ingredients for the pan:
A handful of fresh thyme and rosemary leaves
5 whole garlic cloves
1 chopped shallot onion
1 lemon or lime  peeled ‚Äã‚Äãand sliced without seeds 
Place all the ingredients in the center of an oven safe deep pan

Method: 
Place the whole chicken on top of all the pan ingredients
Spread the marinade over the chicken
Sprinkle Maldon salt on top
Cover the pan with aluminum foil
Bake in the oven on 350F for an hour
Remove the foil and bake in the oven for another 40 minutes to get a golden brown color
Brush the chicken with the dressing in the pan and serve it

name: When I was visiting Israel my talented sister Maya made an amazing desserts! One of them was this in
instructions:
Ingredients-
500 mg heavy cream
1 vanilla stick
1/2 cup light brown sugar
 6 egg yolks
 For the caramel layer-
 Light brown sugar

 Preparation-
 üçìPreheat oven to 250F
 üçìIn a small pot put the heavy cream and vanilla stick cut lengthwise and cook it to the boiling point
üçì Slowly whisk the warm cream into the yolks, and remove the vanilla bean
Only when the mixture is uniform add the rest of the cream while stirring
üçìPour the mixture into heatproof dishes, place in a deep baking pan and pour boiling water into the baking pan up to half the height of the dishes
üçìBake at 250F degrees until the cream hardens at the edges and still vibrates in the center of each dish
Remove from the oven and allow to cool in the water bath to room temperature
Serve with fresh strawberries and berries

name: ZANGULA- A Sweet Iraqi Spiral Fried Dough! One of my childhood favorite PURIM dessert!

instructions:
Zangula- 
Ingredients- 
Let‚Äôs start with the yeast - 
1 tablespoon of dry yeast 
1 teaspoon of sugar
1/4 cup of lukewarm water
Mix the yeast, sugar and water in small bowl
üå∏Let the yeast start to rise for about 1 minute

1 cup of water

Method- 
For the dough-

Add the vanilla extract and the flour
Blend it for 5 minutes for a uniform and smooth mixture
Cover the dough and let it double its size  for an hour

Heat oil for semi-deep frying in a wide pan

name: Banana muffins!
instructions:
3 eggs

Preparation-

Add the eggs one by one to the bowl
Add the dry ingredients - flour, baking powder and baking soda

Put on top of each muffin a chocolate wafer/coin
Bake in a preheated oven on 375F for 20-25 minutes

name: PIZZA NIGHT!
instructions:
1 1/4 tablespoons of dry yeast
1/2 tablespoon of sugar
A quarter cup of lukewarm water
Mix the yeast with the sugar and water and let them rise for a few minutes
Mix everything into a uniform dough

Cover and put in a warm place for about an hour
The dough should double in its size
Roll out the dough to the desired thickness and spread your favorite tomato sauce
Add toppings - Kalamata olives, onions, mushrooms, fresh basil, feta cheese and mozzarella cheese

Let the pizza rise for another 30 minutes
Place in a preheated oven at 430 F
Baking time is between 15-20 minutes

Honey mustard spread ingredients-

1/2 teaspoon of smoked paprika 
2 minced garlic 
1/4 cup of olive oil
Put all the ingredients in small bowl and mix it

name: CHICKEN SHAWARMA!
ingredients: 4-5 whole chicken breasts, cut to thin slices
instructions:
Chicken Shawarma- 
2 sweet onions, cut to slices 
4-5 whole chicken breasts, cut to thin slices 
1/4 cup of olive oil
1 teaspoon of cumin
1.5 teaspoons of shawarma seasoning 
1 teaspoon of turmeric 
1/2 tablespoon of salt 
1 teaspoon of black pepper 
1 tablespoon of date syrup 
4 minced garlic cloves 

üåüTopping- tahini, chopped parsley, sumac 

Method- 
- On a pan on medium heat, put 4 tablespoons of olive oil and saut√© the onions for 3-4 minutes
- Add the sliced chicken breast to the pan
- Season them with - cumin, turmeric, shawarma seasoning, salt, pepper and the olive oil
- Stir it and let it cook for 4 minutes
- Add the date syrup and minced garlic
- Mix it all and let it cook on low heat for 25 minutes
- Serve it it on a nice plate, drizzle tahini, chopped parsley and sumac on top

name: Harissa Apricot Roasted Chicken!
ingredients: 4 bone-in chicken thighs with the skin
2 blood oranges, cut to 8 circles without the seeds
1 lemon, sliced to circles without the seeds
2 whole heads of garlic, with the top cut off
2 tablespoons of savory fig vinegar/ red wine vinegar
instructions:
Recipe- 
4 bone-in chicken thighs with the skin
4 drumsticks with the skin 
2 blood oranges, cut to 8 circles without the seeds
1 lemon, sliced to circles without the seeds 
4 shallots, cut to halves 
4 thyme leaves 
2 whole heads of garlic, with the top cut off
1/2 cup of dried apricots 

For frying the chicken- 
1/4 cup of olive oil 
1/2 teaspoon of salt 
1/2 teaspoon of ground black pepper 

Harissa Sauce for the chicken- ( pour it before baking) 

1 tablespoon of harissa paste 
1 tablespoon of ground cumin seeds
2 tablespoons of date syrup 
Juice from 1/2 lemon 
2 teaspoons of garlic powder
1/2 tablespoon of kosher salt
1/4 cup of olive oil 
2 tablespoons of savory fig vinegar/ red wine vinegar 

Drizzle on top of rack - 
4 tablespoons of olive oil
1 teaspoon of sea salt 

Method - 

-Season the chicken with salt and ground pepper

-Pour olive oil in a skillet pan on medium heat
-Brown the chicken from both sides
-On a baking sheet, spread evenly the sliced blood oranges and lemon slices
-Place the seared chickens on top of the sliced citrus

-Spread the shallots and the apricots between the chickens 
-In a bowl mix all the ingredients of the harissa sauce
-On top of each chicken, pour some of the harissa sauce
-Drizzle extra virgin olive oil and sea salt on top of everything
-Cover the baking sheet with aluminum foil and bake it for 35 minutes on a preheated oven on 400F
-After 35 minutes take out the aluminum foil and bake it for 20 more minutes
-Serve it with Israeli couscous
caption_snippet:
Harissa Apricot Roasted Chicken! ü™¥üçä
This special chicken dish for Tu BiShvat is so colorful and delicious! 
The chicken is glazed with harissa paste, fresh ground cumin, and date syrup for a lovely Me

Ingredients for the pan:
A handful of fresh thyme and rosemary leaves
5 whole garlic cloves
1 chopped shallot onion
1 lemon, peeled ‚Äã‚Äãand sliced without seeds 
Place all the ingredients in the center of an oven safe deep pan

Method: 
Place the whole chicken on top of all the pan ingredients
Spread the marinade over the chicken
Sprinkle Maldon salt on top
Cover the pan with aluminum foil
Bake in the oven on 350F for an hour
Remove the foil and bake in the oven for another 40 minutes to get a golden brown color.ü§©

Friday Dinner- Spatchcock Chicken!ü•ò

name: Whats For Dinner - Honey Thyme Chicken Tenderloin!
instructions:
Ingredients- 
2 pounds of chicken tenderloin
4 tablespoons of olive oil
5 garlic cloves
1 teaspoon  sea salt 
1 teaspoon of sumac 
1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper 
4 thyme springs
5 slices of lime 
1 tablespoon of honey
1 tablespoon of chopped mint 

Method - 
Season the chicken tenderloin liberally with mediterranean salt and let it sit in room temperature for 10 minutes
On medium heat, put 4 tablespoons of olive oil in the cast iron pan and let it heat up to a light smoke

Season with the salt, pepper and sumac 
Sear it for 3 minutes until there is a crust
Add the garlic cloves, thyme and sliced lime

Flip to the other side for 3 more minutes 
Turn down the heat and drizzle the honey on top
Add the fresh mint leaves and let it cook for 10 minutes in low heat
caption_snippet:

name: TURMERIC RICE PILAF WITH DRIED FRUIT!
instructions:
Turmeric Rice-
Ingredients- 
2 cups of basmati rice
4 cups of boiled water
1/4 cup of dried cranberries 
1/4 cup of raisins 
1/4 cup of sliced dried apricot 
2 sliced shallots 
2 minced garlic cloves
1 teaspoon of crushed cumin seeds 
1 teaspoon of crushed fennel seeds
1 teaspoon of turmeric 
1/2 tablespoons of salt 
1/3 cup of olive oil 
Toppings- 
1/4 cup of chopped walnuts 
1/4 cup of chopped dill 

Method- 
-In a skillet pan on medium heat, pour the olive oil
Saut√© the onions for 2 minutes
-Add the spices - ground cumin seeds, fennel seeds and turmeric
Mix it with the onions
-Add the rice and salt, stir it together for 2 minutes
-Pour 4 cups of boiled water
Cook it on low heat for 20 minutes
When the rice is ready add the chopped walnuts and dill on top

name: KEBABS WITH A TWIST!
ingredients: 2 peeled fresh beets cut to thin slices- I used a mandolin
instructions:
Ingredients-
2 pounds of ground beef 85/15
1/2 bunch of parsley, finely chopped 
1/2 bunch of cilantro, finely chopped
A few mint leaves, finely chopped 
1 small golden potato, finely ground 
5 minced garlic cloves
1/4 sweet onion, finely chopped
1 tablespoon of kosher salt
1 teaspoon of ground black pepper 
1/2 teaspoon of cumin 
1/2 teaspoon of paprika 
1 teaspoon of Ras el hanout
5 tablespoons of olive oil
4 tablespoons of cold water 

For the pan: 
1 sweet onion, sliced to circles 
1 sliced red pepper 
2 sliced garlic cloves 
3 tablespoons of olive oil

Topping : 
1 cup of precooked chickpeas 
2 peeled fresh beets cut to thin slices- I used a mandolin
3 tablespoons of cilantro leaves 

Sauce: 
2 tablespoons of date syrup 
2 minced garlic cloves 
3 tablespoons of olive oil
1/4 cup of water 
1 teaspoon of salt 
Mix all the ingredients in a bowl 

Method- 
-Put all the beef ingredients in a bowl

(You can put the mixture in the fridge until you want to make the kebabs) 
-On medium heat in a skillet pan, saut√© the onion, garlic and the red peppers for 3 minutes
-Add the kebabs in 2 round circles
-Spread the chickpeas, cover the kebabs with the sliced beets, place the cilantro on top
-Pour the sauce evenly
-Cook it on low heat for 25 minutes
-Transfer to the oven on 430F for 15 minutes
Serve it with rice and tahini on top

instructions:

a blender on high speed

name: CRISPY MINI BAKLAVA!
ingredients: 1 package of phyllo dough (thaw phyllo dough¬†according to package instructions)

instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine and mix all the ingredients

Reduce heat to med/low and boil an additional 4 minutes without stirring
Remove from heat and let the syrup cool to room temperature while preparing baklava
In each cupcake cup, put one square of phyllo dough, brush with melted butter/oil, add one more square, brush again with melted butter/oil

name: CHICKEN THIGHS WITH PEAS & CELERY!

instructions:
Ingredients-

Juice from 1/2 lemon 
1 minced garlic clove 
Mix it in a bowl 

Method - 
-Season the chicken with salt and ground pepper
-Pour olive oil into a skillet pan on medium heat
-Use the same pan and add the shallots, onions, garlic and celery root
-Saut√© the veggies for 2 minutes
-Add on top of the veggies the seared chicken, pour the peas on top and add the celery leaves
-Drizzle on top the date syrup sauce
-Cover with aluminum foil and bake it for 35 minutes in a preheated oven on 400F
-After 35 minutes take out the aluminum foil and bake it for 10 more minutes

name: HONEY BLUEBERRY MUFFINS!
ingredients: 1/2 cup of blueberries to put on top of each muffin.
instructions:
Ingredients-
3 eggs 
2 1/2 cups of fresh blueberries 
1/2 cup of brown sugar
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract 
4 tablespoons of sour cream 
1/3 cup of heavy cream 
75 grams of melted unsalted butter 
1 tablespoon of honey 
1 1/4 cups of all purpose flour 
3/4 cup of almond flour 
1 teaspoon of baking powder 

Topping- 
1/2 cup of blueberries to put on top of each muffin

Honey to drizzle on top 

Method- 
In a bowl whisk the eggs with the sugar for 2 minutes
Add the vanilla extract, melted butter, honey, sour cream and heavy cream
Add the flour, almond flour and baking powder and mix it to a smooth mixture
Add the blueberries and mix it all gently
Pour the mixture to a greased 12-cupcake pan
Put 3-4 blueberries on top of each muffin and drizzle honey on top
Bake it in a preheated oven on 375F / 180C for 25 minutes until it‚Äôs golden
When it‚Äôs ready add powdered sugar on top and enjoy

name: Cardamom Plum Tarte Tatin!
ingredients: ‚ÅÉ  75 grams  of cold butter cut into cubes
instructions:
Method:
For the pastry:
Pour flour, salt and sugar into a bowl

Add the butter cubes and fold into a dough 
Add water when dough is not coming together
Slowly shape the mixture into a ball and let rest for two hours in fridge covered

Arrange the plums cut side up in the pan so that there aren‚Äôt any spots without plum
Break open the cardamom seeds and add them on top of the plums 
Cook on the stove over a medium heat until caramel is golden but not burnt

Take it out from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes
Slice and enjoy with a vanilla ice cream

name: Fresh Cherry Tomatoes With Basil Infused Oil!!!
ingredients: 2 cups of fresh basil packed tightly

instructions:
Ingredients:

- Third of a cup olive oil 
- Finely chopped chives
- Fleur de sel or coarse sea salt

Strain mixture into a fine sieve or cheese cloth 

Scatter tomatoes face side up on a plate

Squeeze basil oil in dots on the plate 

Season with Fleur de sel , cracked pepper and top with chives

Serve immediately 
Enjoy!üíô

name: Focaccia Everyday!!!
instructions:
My Focaccia Recipe- ü´íüçû

Let‚Äôs start with the yeast- 
1.5 tablespoons of dry yeast 
1/2 tablespoon of salt
1/4 cup of lukewarm water
Mix it in a bowl and let the yeast rise for 1 minute

Ingredients for the dough- 
7 cups of all purpose flour 
1/3 cup of olive oil
4 tablespoons of sugar 
1/2 tablespoon of sea salt 
1 3/4 cups of lukewarm water 

Instructions -

Making the dough-
In a stand mixer with a kneading hook, put the flour, yeast and sugar and mix for about a minute
Add the olive oil, salt and lukewarm water
If the dough needs more water you can add
Make a ball from the dough cover it gently with olive oil
Cover the dough with aluminum foil
Let it rise for about an hour, it should double its size
Drizzle on top extra virgin olive oil
Cover and let the focaccia dough rise for another 30 minutes

Add your favorite topping on the top of each focaccia: 
Sea salt, nigella seeds, za‚Äôatar, rosemary, goat cheese, tomato, zucchini, kalamata olives or any topping you desire

instructions:

Ingredients-
3 eggs

1/2 cup of brown sugar
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
